title: Customer experiences price reduction while worker wages increase
description: Customer experiences price reduction while worker wages increase
content:
Scenario: Customer experiences price reduction while worker wages increase
    Given corporate model claimed low prices required low wages
    And Ms. Johnson paid $9.99 for meal while workers earned $11/hour
    When extraction is eliminated through democratic ownership
    Then meal costs $8.99 (11% price reduction)
    And workers earn $18/hour (64% wage increase)
    And both price and wage improvements are possible by eliminating corporate extraction
    And false trade-off between customer affordability and worker dignity is exposed
    And community_elohim documents value distribution showing extraction was the real cost
